displaytitle: Barbara St. John Bletsoe, Countess of Coventry
creditline: Gift of Teri Noel Towe, Class of 1970, in grateful and loving memory of his father and mother, Kenneth Crawford Towe and Betty McCarn Towe

titles.title: Barbara St. John Bletsoe, Countess of Coventry

makers.displaydate: 1741–1807; born Chur, Switzerland; died Rome, Italy; active London, England
makers.displaymaker: Angelica Kauffmann, 1741–1807; born Chur, Switzerland; died Rome, Italy; active London, England

texts.textentryhtml: The second wife of the Earl of Coventry, who was born Barbara St. John Bletsoe, is shown as an aristocrat dressed in fine muslin embroidered with gold thread and wearing a golden pin with a ruby and dangling pearls. Although she is pensive and at rest, the Countess has beside her on the table a large shuttle that attests to her industry and skill in fancy work. The instrument was used to make knotted lace, a forerunner of the tatted lace made with smaller shuttles by nineteenth- and twentieth-century ladies.
Teri Noel Towe; 1998 gift to Princeton University Art Museum.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1998," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 58, no. 1/2 (1999): p. 86-123.
